{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3144119,"name":"Berkin","username":"brknarsy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/53a042/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T12:34:08.022Z","cooked":"

This year, our team uses 4 spark max controllers for the drive but we only have 2 can cables. These can cables have a special connector type. We’re looking for buying 2 more but we couldn’t find what they are called. Can someone help us?

image1920×2560 191 KB

image1920×2560 173 KB

You can buy the CAN SPARK Max Connectors from REV’s site.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T12:56:55.573Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"Christian Femia","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1880/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SPARK MAX CAN Cable V2 - 2 Pack - REV Robotics","clicks":22}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45546,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144125,"name":"Berkin","username":"brknarsy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/53a042/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T13:09:07.477Z","cooked":"

Thanks but shipment takes too long, is there a chance that we could buy it on a local electronics shop?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T13:09:07.477Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":34.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"Berkin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":45546,"username":"ChristianFemia","name":"Christian Femia","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/christianfemia/{size}/172343_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56296,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144132,"name":"Jeremy Reed","username":"Jreed129","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jreed129/{size}/168565_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T13:41:29.991Z","cooked":"

The description on the REV site that Christian posted says

These SPARK MAX CAN cables have a JST-PH 4-pin connector on one end, and one male and one female 0.1in 3-pin PWM.

You can try looking for that at a local electronics shop but I believe these might be FRC unique to some extent. The one thing to watch out for if you do find them is I believe there’s a rule that the CAN needs to be a twisted pair of wires

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T13:41:29.991Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":62.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"Jeremy Reed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9353,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 103 - Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/4","custom_user_title":"FRC 103 - Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144133,"name":"Ken Pontbriant","username":"electroken","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electroken/{size}/160387_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T13:43:02.673Z","cooked":"

Those connectors are made by JST and are from their PH series. Amazon has genuine versions and a bunch of knock-offs. You will also need a crimper to apply the terminals. We use this one:

image1200×596 123 KB

Putting 2 wires into one of those terminals will be a real party.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T13:43:02.673Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":51.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"Ken Pontbriant","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/6/c/6c13f5c2ddf4e05312a0388bae416eaccc199ea6.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17612,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 230 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/5","custom_user_title":"FRC 230 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144142,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T14:05:32.308Z","cooked":"
brknarsy:

local electronics

There are some robot supply shops that also make cables on demand. That’s not something they would necessarily advertise but you can ask around. Some already have the supplies and some would have to special order but anything local is faster than getting from USA.

Ken Pontbriant:

Putting 2 wires into one of those terminals will be a real party.

Right! This is not a beginner’s project and likely several would be ruined in practice before getting a good one.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T14:05:32.308Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144146,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T14:34:24.315Z","cooked":"
Ken Pontbriant:

Putting 2 wires into one of those terminals will be a real party.

You don’t technically NEED the jumper between those 2 pairs of CAN wires. It’s there to ensure the CAN bus doesn’t go down if something happens to the SparkMax (i.e. the cable comes loose). Original versions of the SparkMax came with a cable that didn’t have the jumper.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T14:34:24.315Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":27.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/7","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144152,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T14:53:04.227Z","cooked":"

If you can get a crimper like the one that @electroken linked, you may be able to get the connector housings and contacts from a electronic parts distributor that serves the Turkish market. I did a search on Google for “turkey electronic parts distributors” and got a lot of results. Check each one to see if they are really based in Turkey or if they just serve the Turkish market. I found some located in the European Union but don’t know if the shipping time would be acceptable to you.

Looking around on Amazon here is the US, I searched for “jst ph connector assembly” and found connectors with the wires already installed. Searching for the same on the Amazon website for Turkey, I found the part linked below. There may be more with better pricing or delivery. You would have to twist the wires pairs of wires together yourself. Aim for roughly the same number of twists per cm as the ones you already have. I don’t recall if the two short wires that connect the two pairs together are necessary.

https://www.amazon.com.tr/4PİN-0-25mm²-KABLOLU-KONNEKTÖR-TAKIM/dp/B0BHHWPBM6/ref=mp_s_a_1_3?crid=3NV5YZFR439OR&keywords=jst+ph+connector+assembly&qid=1676213337&sprefix=jst+ph+connector+assembly%2Caps%2C232&sr=8-3

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T14:53:04.227Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":39.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com.tr/4P%C4%B0N-0-25mm%C2%B2-KABLOLU-KONNEKT%C3%96R-TAKIM/dp/B0BHHWPBM6/ref=mp_s_a_1_3?crid=3NV5YZFR439OR&keywords=jst+ph+connector+assembly&qid=1676213337&sprefix=jst+ph+connector+assembly%2Caps%2C232&sr=8-3","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144156,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T15:12:13.682Z","cooked":"

That jumper has been known to come out and is also a different wire guage for some inexplicable reason. Bit of a hack job.

Maybe things are better this year and this production run.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T15:12:13.682Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426565,"topic_slug":"spark-max-connector-type","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-connector-type/426565/9","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3144165,"name":"Ian McTavish","username":"Ian_McTavish","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/b5a626/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T15:32:07.075Z","cooked":"

The reason the wires are twisted is to ensure that electromagnetic interference affects the signal in both wires uniformly, limiting errors.

You can make the wires yourself the only challenge is finding connectors and crimping them properly to fit in the sparkmax.

3DP roboRIO Molex Adapters","id":499467,"title":"Never Hot Glue Your RIO Again (Almost) - 3DP roboRIO Molex Adapters","slug":"never-hot-glue-your-rio-again-almost-3dp-roborio-molex-adapters","posts_count":8,"reply_count":2,"highest_post_number":8,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2025-04-15T23:22:13.959Z","last_posted_at":"2025-04-16T00:49:35.034Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-04-16T00:49:35.034Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"Tired of picking hot glue out of your roboRIO at the end of every season?
